{static is} The New Dynamic

Following the Post-CMS paradigm

About the Site

The purpose of this site is to promote the use of static site generators for people who build websites. I hope to fill the site out and as it grows add functionality to to make it easy to find resources and information related to the top static site generators.

The site will be editorially driven; that is, it will not attempt to be comprehensive, just, hopefully, interesting.

Soon, I will make the tags live links and add search and other functionality.

Pull requests welcome

Details of the site.

This site is built with Jekyll with my own theme coded by hand in Sublime Text and is published to Github Pages.

I have a branch of this site published to an AWS S3 bucket, using @laurilehmijoki’s excellent S3_website gem and Travis Continuous Integration Service to push my builds from Github to S3. Here are some tutorials:

  • “Host a static site on Amazon S3 & deploy with Github & Travis”, by Charles Lirsac and the gang from nowhere becaause there ti s no sumehwere
  • “Static website on S3, CloudFront and Route 53, the right way!”, by Michaël Gallego
  • “Deploying your Jekyll Site to S3 with Travis CI”, by Mathias Meyer
Author: Bud Parr Github Twitter
